CatDescriptText: Mrs. Martha Adair, Sheridan, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "I've always figured that discrimination is wrong. But on the other hand, I think that colored people should have enough pride that if they are not wanted in a cemetery they should go build their own the same as other nationalities have done."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Martha Adair wearing flecked coat with three diagonal buttons on chest, eyeglasses, and hat with netting, standing outside
